pull.title: wallet: consolidate CoinSelectionParams::m_change_target and m_min_change_target
pull.body: These values are both intended for the same thing. Their divergence seems to be the result of an incomplete rename.

[coin selection] consolidate m_change_target and m_min_change_target

These values are both intended for the same thing. Their divergence
seems to be the result of an incomplete rename.

events.message:
[coin selection] consolidate m_change_target and m_min_change_target

These values are both intended for the same thing. Their divergence
seems to be the result of an incomplete rename.

events.body:
ACK acda7e86

was asking the same in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25647#discussion_r943528337
(Credit to @S3RK for pointing this out to me)

ACK acda7e8686a1f7a967d6331a2f6a3a01389c3048

I'm surprised this didn't get caught by tests. Perhaps we are missing one for the minimum change. My gut feeling is that it wouldn't be trivial to test, so that might be out of scope for this PR, though.

ACK acda7e8686a1f7a967d6331a2f6a3a01389c3048.
Verified `m_change_target` is unused and `m_min_change_target` is the variable that should be used.
